measured_by: four-item alcohol stigma scale (adapted from Dilevski et al., 2022)
justification: "A four-item measure adapted from Dilevski et al. (2022) assessed alcohol stigma."

measured_by: Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test – Consumption (AUDIT-C)
justification: "The three-item Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test-Consumption (AUDIT-C; Bush et al., 1998) assessed personal alcohol consumption."
"Participants rated the accuracy of their ability to judge their own intoxication level. Responses were delivered on a 7-point Likert scale (1 = Not accurately at all, 7 = Extremely accurately)."
construct: Perceived accuracy of judging one’s own intoxication

measured_by: twelve-item usefulness scale of evidence formats (7-point Likert)
justification: "A twelve-item measure assessed preferred evidence formats when judging a person's intoxication status and its relevance to a legal case. Responses were delivered on a 7-point Likert scale."

measured_by: three items (intoxication level, standard drinks, BAC) adapted from Monds et al., 2021a
justification: "Participants indicated when alcohol impairs a person's memory for events in terms of intoxication level (low, moderate, or severe), standard drinks, and BAC. All three items were adapted from Monds et al. (2021a)."

measured_by: three items (intoxication level, standard drinks, BAC) adapted from Monds et al., 2021a
justification: "These items were repeated to determine thresholds for impaired capacity for sexual consent."
construct: Perceived threshold for impaired capacity for sexual consent
